1.0.name: wordpress/rename-wp-login
1.0.description:
What it does

This plugin renames wp-login.php to whatever you want. The default is example.com/login/ if no such page already exists. Otherwise it will append a number, e.g. login-1. You can change this under ‘Settings’ › ‘Permalinks’ › ‘Login’. Please remember what you changed your login page to, accessing wp-login.php or wp-admin/ will not work and will return a 404 not found status.

Compatibility

Works with BuddyPress, Limit Login Attempts and most other plugins that customise the login page. This plugin doesn't break the registration form, lost password form, expired sessions or any of wp-login.php’s functionality. Plugins that hook into the standard login form will keep working. It doesn’t break wp_login_form(), so login forms in widgets will work too.

While it might work with earlier versions of WordPress, you should al
